channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App Travel Section
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App Travel Section

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: They met on Valentine's Day while hiking in the Himalayas
item.description: It was Valentine's Day 1996 when British backpacker Lee Green walked into a mountain lodge in Nepal and encountered New Zealand traveler Mandy Halse for the first time. The two have been exploring the world together ever since.

item.title: How can we end empty 'ghost' flights?
item.description: Two years into the coronavirus pandemic, airlines are still being forced to run empty or near-empty "ghost flights" in order to hold onto coveted airport slots.

item.title: The fairy-tale landscape of Slovenia's Julian Alps
item.description: Slovenia's northwestern corner is packed with spectacular landscapes of towering peaks, waterfalls, rushing rivers and pristine mountain lakes, many of which are contained within Triglav, the country's only national park.

item.title: Where to see the oldest living things on Earth
item.description: Planet ramblers looking for adventure might consider spending time with these 10 living ambassadors from the past, including a bird with millions of flight miles, a rose that survived an aerial bombing and a tree linked to Buddha.

item.title: These fancy new airline seats don't recline
item.description: Finnair's new business class Airlounge seats, soon to be rolled out across its A330 and A350 fleets, don't recline. Instead, passengers will be provided with cushions and padding to achieve their preferred positions.

item.title: The world's most fascinating abandoned towns and cities
item.description: Once thriving spots, these villages, towns and cities now stand abandoned. Their empty buildings, streets and even cars left for nature to reclaim over the years.

item.title: How London almost got its own Eiffel Tower
item.description: London was once on track to have its own bigger, better Eiffel Tower, a gigantic metal creation that would rise to 1,200 feet. But as the creation rose over the city's suburbs, it all went wrong.

item.title: Two strangers meet on an airplane. Four years later they fall in love
item.description: High school seniors Schereéya and Anton crossed paths while flying to Virginia for a college acceptance day. Over the next few years, the two weaved in and out of one another's lives, before a road trip to New Orleans cemented their relationship.

item.title: 24 hours on the Coast Starlight, one of America's most scenic train routes
item.description: Along the West Coast of the United States, 1,377 miles of railroad tracks run from Seattle to Los Angeles -- a route often named as one of the most beautiful train journeys in America.

item.title: Why airline route maps look the way they do
item.description: If you've ever played with the in-flight route maps on board a plane or browsed the destinations on an airline's website, it all looks pretty simple.

item.title: Ever wonder how athletes plan their lavish trips? Here's the man who organizes them
item.description: Luxury concierge Johnny Vegas works with sporting superstars to planning entire vacations, from accommodation to daily itineraries. Having already established himself in parts of the United States and Spain, Vegas is looking to expand his concierge empire in Dubai.

item.title: Beneath the Great Wall of China lies the world's deepest high-speed railway station
item.description: With the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics fast approaching, the world's first self-driving high-speed train is already in action, transporting athletes and officials between the two main cities hosting the games on the historic Beijing-Zhangjiakou intercity railway.

item.title: New Zealand announces plans to reopen to the world
item.description: New Zealand has announced it will begin reopening to the world, signaling an end to nearly two years of tough border rules that have separated families and shut out almost all foreigners.

item.title: What is it like to fly on a small plane compared to a big plane?
item.description: What's the difference between flying on a small plane versus a large one, besides the price?

item.title: 10 prettiest ski resorts in Europe for alpine fans
item.description: Choosing the most beautiful ski resort in the Alps is like picking the prettiest diamond.

item.title: Plane battling winds at Heathrow nearly topples over
item.description: As storms buffet the UK, footage has emerged of a pilot pulling off a particularly challenging landing -- but not before the plane appeared to nearly topple over and scrape its tail on the runway.

item.title: Retired British Airways jet transformed into $1,300 per hour 'party plane'
item.description: Suzannah Harvey, chief executive of the Cotswold Airport near Kemble in England, bought the Negus 747 for just over a $1 back in October 2020 and has spent around 14 months converting it into a versatile events space.

item.title: Lunar New Year 2022: Welcoming the Year of the Tiger
item.description: A guide to the most common Lunar New Year traditions and superstitions, as well as insights from some of Hong Kong's most established geomancers on what the Year of the Tiger might have in store.

item.title: A spinal fluid leak derailed my life of travel and food, but taught me to find beauty in the small things
item.description: During any life-changing event, there comes a moment when the fog of the crisis temporarily clears, and you realize with certainty that things will never be the same again.

item.title: What should I do if my flight has been canceled or delayed?
item.description: It has been a tough slog for some air travelers ever since the winter holidays rush.

item.title: Thailand: Home of massage, monks and meditation
item.description: Richard Quest explores Bangkok's Wat Pho temple to visit its famed massage school and take in a meditation lesson with the venerable Deputy Abbot.

item.title: A 50-year pen pal friendship that began with a message in a bottle
item.description: Robbinroger Beever was 15 years old and walking home along a beach in Liberia, West Africa.

item.title: Woman gives birth over the Atlantic during a flight from Africa to the US
item.description: Talk about a memorable arrival into the world -- or, in this case, above the world.

item.title: You're trapped in a blizzard. Do you know what to do next to survive?
item.description: Warm thoughts of young romance -- not the cold, harsh possibilities of a Midwestern road trip in winter -- were on Dawn O'Hair's mind as she left Chicago for Indianapolis to see her boyfriend.

item.title: Ancient Bhutan trail set to open for first time in 60 years
item.description: Bhutan is one of the world's most mysterious countries.

item.title: Tourist thrown out of Venice for sunbathing topless on war memorial
item.description: The 30-year-old visitor from the Czech Republic was fined $513 and banned from the city for 48 hours, after she was caught swimming in the lagoon and posing topless for photos beside a statue of a murdered war hero.

item.title: What is turnip cake and why is it a popular Lunar New Year dish?
item.description: Not all Lunar New Year foods are created equal. Some only make a brief appearance at the festival for auspicious purposes. Others are so delicious they grace dim sum tables around the world all year.

item.title: The couple who fell in love in Antarctica
item.description: Nicole McGrath and Cole Heinz fell in love while working ﻿at McMurdo Station, a US research facility built on volcanic rock on Ross Island, surrounded by mountains, snow and ice.

item.title: CDC adds 5 more Caribbean island destinations to its highest level of travel risk
item.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention moved five Caribbean island destinations into its highest-risk travel category for Covid-19 on Monday.

item.title: Why pet owners in Hong Kong are hiring private planes for their pets
item.description: Many people who are moving away from the financial capital have been unable to secure flights out of the city for their dogs and cats, leading to online groups where desperate pet parents try to pool their money to cover the cost of a charter plane.
